intro: Ericoides viridiflorum, commonly known as the greenflower heath, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and moorlands. Ericoides viridiflorum is adapted to cool, moist climates and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
